ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: ANTH 759 01 is a very interesting course that give student an overview on different theoretical perspectives and methods used to make interpretations about various aspects of social organization and social change in the past. It helps student review different models or even formulate his/her own model.
I will definitely recommend this course to other students since it can give students basic and further study topics and points in the archaeological studies.

comfortable atmosphere, good choice of reading material and super careful comments from the professor over every piece of writing she assigns. A good experience and solid training in Chinese archaeology.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The course enriched my theoretical foundation on various aspects of social organization and social change
After studying the course, I deepened my idea in the study of Chinese archaeology and trend ideas of many scholars, all of which will broaden our sight of research, in terms of methodology and ideas.
An enlightenment that leads me to the front of Chinese archaeology.
